sub_topic: Identifying the clique number of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

```
       A -- B
      / \    |
     C---D-- E
      \ |   /
        F - G
```

What is the clique number of this graph?
message_2: The clique number of a graph is the size of the largest complete subgraph (clique) within the graph. In this case, the largest clique is formed by the vertices C, D, and F, which are all connected to each other. Therefore, the clique number of this graph is 3.
